The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: With much of our care redesign already in place prior to the launch of BPCIA, our high priorities were limited to the introduction of telehealth, patient level coordination with PCPs, and clinical and administrative staff engagement.  All three of these initiatives are launched within a portion of our at risk sites with plans for expansion. We feel well on our way to achieving these high priority goals as intended.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: No challenges to report.  We have had increased success at implementing our care redesign interventions at new sites thanks to a streamlined new site implementation process that heavily focuses on the fundamentals of BPCIA.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a succession plan in place for when individuals in management or individuals who oversee implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model depart the organization?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: In the event a manager departs the organization, the individuals senior manager will oversee all implementation duties in the interim. The senior manager will remove all access for the manager that departed the organization and will update any contact information as necessary. The senior manager will meet with the team involved in the implementation of the BPC Advanced Model to confirm if all deliverables and implementation are on track until an individual is hired and trained.

If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Response: The initial CMS Beneficiary Notification letter contained our organization  phone number where the beneficiary can call if they had any questions. The theme of the questions we received are :- Beneficiary did not understand the letter and the initiative with Medicare - Beneficiaries wanted to know if there was this an an additional cost to them - Some beneficiaries reported, that when speaking with someone at Medicare to get more information about the model, the person with Medicare were not aware of the initiative.

Text: Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.

Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: Sound has developed a data analytic platform and clinical integration strategy to monitor and mitigate unintended consequences for our BPCIA patients.  We have developed an IT platform to collect data on each patient participating in the BPCIA program to monitor their next site of care, readmissions (all NSOC locations and root cause DRGs), SNF length of stay, SNF readmissions, use of high quality network agencies and facilities, and alignment with patient clinical desires of care with advance care planning.  We use our analytics to evaluate the outcomes of our patients in order to adjust our future interventions involving our physicians, nurses, care coordinating team, outpatient resources, and etc.  Our clinical team evaluates our patient care while in the acute setting and in the post acute setting for a 90 day window.  We have nurses, physicians, and care coordinators that link the care in the acute to the post acute setting to mitigate and monitor outcomes and possible unintended consequences.  This care team is integrated into our data and communication platforms to help drive performance and outcomes for each of our patients.

Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?
Please provide any barriers or challenges associated with submitting required documentation.
Response: We have many active BPIDs as a participant. We have noticed that we do not receive all the notifications from CMS for each participant via email, whether it be general notifications, updates, or action items that are due in specific time-frame.  Due to this, we would need to check each BPID to make sure that the "Action Item" notifications pertain to one or all. In this case, we received ACQ action items for 10 BPIDs, out of 78, but in reviewing the portal we need to submit for all 78 BPIDs.
